title: RuntimeError: copy_if failed to synchronize: device-side assert triggered
body:
I'm trying to train my own dataset, but there is an error occured, I don't know why, the logs are as follows:



/usr/bin/python3.5 /home/kun/master/SSD-master/train_ssd.py
2019-07-14 16:52:48,165 SSD INFO: Using 1 GPUs
2019-07-14 16:52:48,165 SSD INFO: Namespace(config_file='configs/ssd300_hdyd.yaml', distributed=False, eval_step=5000, local_rank=0, log_step=50, num_gpus=1, opts=[], resume=None, save_step=5000, skip_test=False, use_tensorboard=True, vgg='vgg16_reducedfc.pth')
2019-07-14 16:52:48,167 SSD INFO: Loaded configuration file configs/ssd300_hdyd.yaml
2019-07-14 16:52:48,167 SSD INFO: 
MODEL:
  NUM_CLASSES: 1
INPUT:
  IMAGE_SIZE: 300
DATASETS:
  TRAIN: ("hdyd_19051101_train",)
  TEST: ("hdyd_19051101_test", )
SOLVER:
  MAX_ITER: 20000
  LR_STEPS: [80000, 100000]
  GAMMA: 0.1
  BATCH_SIZE: 16
  LR: 1e-3
2019-07-14 16:52:48,167 SSD INFO: Running with config:

  TEST: ('hdyd_19051101_test',)
  TRAIN: ('hdyd_19051101_train',)
INPUT:
  IMAGE_SIZE: 300
  PIXEL_MEAN: [123, 117, 104]

  DEVICE: cuda
  NEG_POS_RATIO: 3
  NUM_CLASSES: 1
  PRIORS:
    ASPECT_RATIOS: [[2], [2, 3], [2, 3], [2, 3], [2], [2]]
    BOXES_PER_LOCATION: [4, 6, 6, 6, 4, 4]
    CLIP: True
    FEATURE_MAPS: [38, 19, 10, 5, 3, 1]
    MAX_SIZES: [60, 111, 162, 213, 264, 315]
    MIN_SIZES: [30, 60, 111, 162, 213, 264]
    STRIDES: [8, 16, 32, 64, 100, 300]
  SIZE_VARIANCE: 0.2
  THRESHOLD: 0.5
OUTPUT_DIR: output
SOLVER:
  BATCH_SIZE: 16
  GAMMA: 0.1
  LR: 0.001
  LR_STEPS: [80000, 100000]
  MAX_ITER: 20000
  MOMENTUM: 0.9
  WARMUP_FACTOR: 0.3333333333333333
  WARMUP_ITERS: 500
  WEIGHT_DECAY: 0.0005
TEST:
  CONFIDENCE_THRESHOLD: 0.01
  MAX_PER_CLASS: 200
  MAX_PER_IMAGE: -1
  NMS_THRESHOLD: 0.45
2019-07-14 16:52:50,684 SSD.trainer INFO: Init from base net vgg16_reducedfc.pth
2019-07-14 16:52:50,718 SSD.trainer INFO: Train dataset size: 1928
2019-07-14 16:52:50,718 SSD.trainer INFO: Start training
/pytorch/aten/src/THCUNN/ClassNLLCriterion.cu:105: void cunn_ClassNLLCriterion_updateOutput_kernel(Dtype *, Dtype *, Dtype *, long *, Dtype *, int, int, int, int, long) [with Dtype = float, Acctype = float]: block: [0,0,0], thread: [10,0,0] Assertion `t >= 0 && t < n_classes` failed.
/pytorch/aten/src/THCUNN/ClassNLLCriterion.cu:105: void cunn_ClassNLLCriterion_updateOutput_kernel(Dtype *, Dtype *, Dtype *, long *, Dtype *, int, int, int, int, long) [with Dtype = float, Acctype = float]: block: [0,0,0], thread: [11,0,0] Assertion `t >= 0 && t < n_classes` failed.
/pytorch/aten/src/THCUNN/ClassNLLCriterion.cu:105: void cunn_ClassNLLCriterion_updateOutput_kernel(Dtype *, Dtype *, Dtype *, long *, Dtype *, int, int, int, int, long) [with Dtype = float, Acctype = float]: block: [0,0,0], thread: [18,0,0] Assertion `t >= 0 && t < n_classes` failed.
/pytorch/aten/src/THCUNN/ClassNLLCriterion.cu:105: void cunn_ClassNLLCriterion_updateOutput_kernel(Dtype *, Dtype *, Dtype *, long *, Dtype *, int, int, int, int, long) [with Dtype = float, Acctype = float]: block: [0,0,0], thread: [19,0,0] Assertion `t >= 0 && t < n_classes` failed.
/pytorch/aten/src/THCUNN/ClassNLLCriterion.cu:105: void cunn_ClassNLLCriterion_updateOutput_kernel(Dtype *, Dtype *, Dtype *, long *, Dtype *, int, int, int, int, long) [with Dtype = float, Acctype = float]: block: [0,0,0], thread: [23,0,0] Assertion `t >= 0 && t < n_classes` failed.
/pytorch/aten/src/THCUNN/ClassNLLCriterion.cu:105: void cunn_ClassNLLCriterion_updateOutput_kernel(Dtype *, Dtype *, Dtype *, long *, Dtype *, int, int, int, int, long) [with Dtype = float, Acctype = float]: block: [0,0,0], thread: [27,0,0] Assertion `t >= 0 && t < n_classes` failed.

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/kun/master/SSD-master/train_ssd.py", line 138, in <module>
    main()
  File "/home/kun/master/SSD-master/train_ssd.py", line 129, in main

  File "/home/kun/master/SSD-master/train_ssd.py", line 71, in train

  File "/home/kun/master/SSD-master/ssd/engine/trainer.py", line 76, in do_train

  File "/home/kun/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 493, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/kun/master/SSD-master/ssd/modeling/ssd.py", line 85, in forward
    regression_loss, classification_loss = self.criterion(confidences, locations, gt_labels, gt_boxes)
  File "/home/kun/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 493, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/kun/master/SSD-master/ssd/modeling/multibox_loss.py", line 37, in forward

RuntimeError: copy_if failed to synchronize: device-side assert triggered
